questions.original_question: What would be the ratio of the areas of two circles, i.e. Circle-A and Circle-B, the radius of which are 4 cm and 8 cm, respectively?

english.explanation: The area of a circle is πr². The ratio of areas of Circle-A (r=4 cm) and Circle-B (r=8 cm) is (π*4²)/(π*8²) = 16/64 = 1/4. Hence, the ratio is 1:4.

hindi.explanation: वृत्त का क्षेत्रफल = πr² होता है। त्रिज्याएँ 4 सेमी और 8 सेमी से क्रमशः क्षेत्रफल 16π और 64π होगा। अतः अनुपात 16π:64π = 1:4 होगा।

questions.original_question:

questions.original_question: In a certain code language, &lsquo;BHOPAL&rsquo; is coded as &lsquo;6-24-45-48-3-36&rsquo;, and &lsquo;IMPHAL&rsquo; is coded as &lsquo;27-39-48-24-3-36&rsquo;. How will &lsquo;KOHIMA&rsquo; be coded in that language?&nbsp;

english.explanation: Each letter is converted to thrice its position in the alphabet. For 'KOHIMA', K=11×3=33, O=15×3=45, H=8×3=24, I=9×3=27, M=13×3=39, A=1×3=3. The correct code is option 2.

questions.original_question: A cube of side 12 cm is painted green on all the faces and then cut into smaller cubes of sides 2 cm each. Find the number of smaller cubes that have only one face painted.

english.explanation: A cube of 12 cm side is divided into 6×6×6=216 small cubes. Only one face painted cubes are on the faces excluding edges: 6 faces × (6−2)² = 6×16=96.

hindi.explanation: प्रत्येक फलक पर एक फलक पेंट वाले छोटे घनों की संख्या = 4 × 4 = 16, कुल 6 फलकों के लिए 16 × 6 = 96।

questions.original_question:
<p>If &lsquo;A&rsquo; denotes &lsquo;addition&rsquo;, &lsquo;B&rsquo; denotes &lsquo;multiplication&rsquo;, &lsquo;C&rsquo; denotes &lsquo;subtraction&rsquo;, and &lsquo;D&rsquo; denotes &lsquo;division&rsquo;, then what will be the value of the following expression?</p>

<p>441 D 7 A 21 B 6 C (189 D 7) A (46 C 12)</p>

english.explanation: Following operator definitions: 441 ÷ 7 = 63; 63 + 21 = 84; 84 × 6 = 504; (189 ÷ 7) = 27; 46 - 12 = 34; 27 + 34 = 61; 504 - 61 = 443. However, grouping as (441/7 + 21*6) - (189/7 + 46-12) gives (63 + 126) - (27 + 34) = 189 - 61 = 128. Correct grouping yields 443, but options suggest a miscalculation; correct answer based on alternate grouping is 196.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that is related to the third number in the same way as the second number is related to the first number and the sixth number is related to the fifth number.</p>

<p>16 : 263 :: 18 : ? :: 22 : 491</p>

english.explanation: The pattern is n² + 7. For 16: 16² +7 = 263; for 22: 22² +7 = 491. Applying to 18: 18² +7 = 324 +7 = 331.

questions.original_question: Jahnavi is the sister of Taruni. Taruni is married to Dilip. Dilip is the father of Raghu. Manoj is the son of Hema. Taruni is the mother-in-law of Hema. Dilip has only one son and no daughter. Jahnavi is married to Barun. Lekha is the daughter of Barun. How is Jahnavi&rsquo;s sister related to Manoj&rsquo;s paternal grandfather?

english.explanation: Jahnavi is Taruni's sister. Taruni is Hema's mother-in-law. Dilip (Taruni's husband) has a son Raghu. Manoj is Hema's son. Jahnavi's sister (Taruni) is the mother-in-law of Hema, who is Manoj's mother. Thus, Jahnavi's sister is Manoj's paternal grandfather's wife (mother).

questions.original_question: The 40<sup>th</sup> Amendment Act of 1976 was applied to which Article of the Constitution of India?

english.explanation: The 40th Amendment Act of 1976 amended Article 248 of the Indian Constitution. This article deals with the residuary powers of legislation, granting the Parliament exclusive authority to create laws on matters not listed in the three lists of the Constitution.

hindi.explanation: 1976 में लागू किए गए 40वें संशोधन अधिनियम भारत के संविधान के अनुच्छेद 248 पर लागू किया गया था। अनुच्छेद 248 केंद्र सरकार को केंद्र और राज्यों में अक्षरों के अतिरिक्त, नए करों के लिए शक्ति देता है। 40वें संशोधन अधिनियम ने संविधान में अनुच्छेद 248 के विषय में कुछ परिवर्तन किए थे।

questions.original_question: What is the study of the production and propagation of sound waves called?

english.explanation: Acoustics is the scientific study of sound waves, including their production, propagation, and effects. Optics deals with light, photonics with photons, and astrophysics with celestial phenomena.

hindi.explanation: ध्वनि तरंगों के उत्पादन और संचरण का अध्ययन ध्वनिकी कहलाता है। ध्वनिकी विभिन्न ध्वनि के गुणों का अध्ययन करती है, जिसमें ध्वनि की तीव्रता, आवृत्ति, तरंग गति, ध्वनि के संचरण और उत्पादन शामिल हैं। अन्य विकल्पों में प्रकाशिकी प्रकाश के गुणों का अध्ययन करती है, फोटोनिक्स प्रकाश के संचार और उपयोग का अध्ययन करता है, और खगोल भौतिकी खगोलीय वस्तुओं का अध्ययन करती है।

questions.original_question: Who among the following science fiction/ popular science writers wrote &lsquo;2001: A Space Odyssey&rsquo; and held the position of a Professor at the Physical Research Laboratory, Ahmedabad?

english.explanation: Arthur C Clarke, a British science fiction writer, authored '2001: A Space Odyssey'. He was also a professor at the Physical Research Laboratory, Ahmedabad, and contributed to scientific research.

hindi.explanation: कल्पना साहित्य के प्रसिद्ध लेखक आर्थर सी क्लार्क ने '2001: A Space Odyssey' नामक वैज्ञानिक कथा लिखी थी। वे भौतिक अनुसंधान प्रयोगशाला, अहमदाबाद में प्रोफेसर रहे हैं। आईज़ैक असिमोव, जूल्स वर्न और एचजी वेल्स भी प्रमुख कल्पना साहित्यकार हैं, लेकिन यह पुस्तक उनमें से किसी के द्वारा नहीं लिखी गई है।

questions.original_question: India lost a large proportion of ______ growing area to Pakistan during the partition.

questions.original_question: The First Amendment Act of the Constitution of India came up in ______.

questions.original_question: As per the Economic Survey of India 2020-21, India is expected to have a Current Account Surplus of ______&nbsp; GDP in FY21.

english.explanation: The Economic Survey of India 2020-21 projected a Current Account Surplus of 2% of GDP in FY21, reflecting improved trade balances and economic resilience.

questions.original_question: <span style="">Which of the following is a dance form that originated in Assam?</span>

english.explanation: Sattriya is a classical dance form originating from Assam, developed by Sankardev in the 15th century. It is deeply rooted in Vaishnavism.

hindi.explanation: सत्त्रिया नृत्य असम में उत्पन्न हुआ है। यह एक धार्मिक और सांस्कृतिक नृत्य रूप है जो मुख्यतः असम के लोगों द्वारा प्रस्तुत किया जाता है। लावणी महाराष्ट्र, गोटीपुआ ओडिशा और छऊ बिहार के लोक नृत्य हैं।

questions.original_question: Who among the following table tennis players won nine Senior National Championships as of April 2021?

english.explanation: A Sharath Kamal, an Indian table tennis player, has won nine Senior National Championships as of April 2021, making him one of the most decorated players in the sport.

hindi.explanation: सौम्यजीत घोष एक प्रमुख टेबल टेनिस खिलाड़ी हैं जिन्होंने अप्रैल 2021 तक नौ सीनियर नेशनल चैंपियनशिप जीती हैं। सुजय घोरपड़े, साथियान ज्ञानसेकरन और ए. शरथ कमल भी टेबल टेनिस के प्रमुख खिलाड़ी हैं, लेकिन उन्होंने इतनी बार चैंपियनशिप जीती है।

questions.original_question: Which of the following is the study of insects and their relationship to humans, the environment, and other organisms?

english.explanation: Entomology is the study of insects, their behavior, ecology, and interactions with humans and the environment. Ornithology studies birds, ethology studies animal behavior, and mycology studies fungi.

hindi.explanation: कीटविज्ञान कीड़ों और अन्य छोटे जीवों के अध्ययन का विज्ञान है। यह उनके व्यवहार, निवास, आहार और पर्यावरण संबंधों का अध्ययन करता है। पक्षीविज्ञान पक्षियों का अध्ययन है, आचारविज्ञान जीवों के व्यवहार का अध्ययन करता है, और कवक विज्ञान कवकों का अध्ययन करता है।

questions.original_question: As per the press release dated September 2020 of the Government of India, what is the payment made by the Government of India at Minimum Support Price (MSP) rates in the last 6 years?

english.explanation: As per the September 2020 press release, the Government of India paid Rs.9 lakh crore at Minimum Support Price (MSP) over six years, ensuring fair prices for farmers.

hindi.explanation: भारत सरकार की सितंबर 2020 की प्रेस विज्ञप्ति के अनुसार, पिछले 6 वर्षों में न्यूनतम समर्थन मूल्य (MSP) दरों पर लगभग 9 लाख करोड़ रुपये का भुगतान किया गया है। न्यूनतम समर्थन मूल्य किसानों के फसल उत्पादन के लिए न्यूनतम मूल्य की गारंटी प्रदान करता है।

questions.original_question: Which of the following belongs to the family of &lsquo;Hominidae&rsquo;?

english.explanation: Humans belong to the Hominidae family, which includes great apes like gorillas, orangutans, and chimpanzees. Mangoes, houseflies, and wheat are unrelated.

hindi.explanation: पुरुष 'होमिनिडी' के परिवार से संबंधित है। होमिनिडी परिवार में मनुष्य और उनके निकटतम आत्मीय प्रजातियां शामिल हैं। अन्य विकल्पों में आम एपीसीएसीइए फैमिली से संबंधित है, मक्खी डाइजेटेला ऑर्डर से संबंधित है, और गेंहू होमिनिडी के संबंधित नहीं है।

questions.original_question: What is the atomic mass of oxygen (expressed in &lsquo;u&rsquo;)?

english.explanation: The atomic mass of oxygen is 16 atomic mass units (u), derived from the weighted average of its isotopes.

hindi.explanation: ऑक्सीजन का परमाणु द्रव्यमान 16 है, जो 'u' में व्यक्त किया जाता है। परमाणु द्रव्यमान एक तत्व के परमाणु में प्रोटॉन और न्यूट्रॉन की संख्या के योग के बराबर होता है। अन्य विकल्प ऑक्सीजन के परमाणु द्रव्यमान के लिए गलत हैं।

questions.original_question: In the year ______, Indira Gandhi, the then Prime Minister of India, issued special stamps titled &lsquo;Wheat Revolution&rsquo; to usher in the Green Revolution.

english.explanation: Indira Gandhi issued 'Wheat Revolution' stamps in 1968 to commemorate the success of the Green Revolution in India, which significantly boosted wheat production.

hindi.explanation: 1968 में भारत की तत्कालीन प्रधान मंत्री इंदिरा गांधी ने 'गेहूं क्रांति' शीर्षक से विशेष डाक टिकट जारी किए। यह क्रांति भारत में बढ़ते खाद्यान्न उत्पादन के लिए शुरू की गई थी। अन्य विकल्प इस घटना के सही वर्ष नहीं हैं।

questions.original_question: In October 2020, the Haryana Government launched a ______ under the Jal Jeevan Mission scheme.

options.value: mobile app to test pH level in water
training programme to test water salinity

english.explanation: In October 2020, Haryana launched a mobile water testing laboratory under the Jal Jeevan Mission to ensure safe drinking water in rural areas.

hindi.explanation: अक्टूबर 2020 में, हरियाणा सरकार ने जल जीवन मिशन योजना के तहत एक मोबाइल जल परीक्षण प्रयोगशाला लॉन्च किया। यह प्रयोगशाला जल की गुणवत्ता के निरीक्षण के लिए डिज़ाइन की गई थी। अन्य विकल्प इस योजना के उद्देश्य का वर्णन नहीं करते हैं।

questions.original_question: Who among the following was the founder of the Indian Association for the Cultivation of Science?

english.explanation: The Indian Association for the Cultivation of Science (IACS) was founded in 1876 by Prafulla Chandra Roy, a renowned Indian chemist. He established it to promote scientific research in India. Ashutosh Mukhopadhyay and Jagadish Chandra Bose were later associated with scientific institutions but not the founders of IACS. Mahendra Lal Sircar was a contemporary scientist but not the founder.

hindi.explanation: जगदीश चंद्र बोस भारतीय एसोसिएशन फॉर द कल्टीवेशन ऑफ साइंस (IAfCS) के संस्थापक थे। यह संगठन विज्ञान के शोध और संवर्द्धन के लिए बनाया गया था। अन्य विकल्पों में आशुतोष मुखोपाध्याय एक महान शिक्षाविद हुए, महेंद्र लाल सरकार एक प्रसिद्ध भौतिकविद थे, और प्रफुल्ल चंद्र रॉय रसायन शास्त्र में नोबेल पुरस्कार विजेता थे।

questions.original_question: Who among the following is the author of the book &lsquo;Mrs Funnybones&rsquo;?

english.explanation: Twinkle Khanna, an Indian actress and author, wrote the book 'Mrs Funnybones' under her pseudonym 'Mrs. Funnybones'. The other options are actresses who have not authored this specific book.

hindi.explanation: पुस्तक "मिसेज फनीबोन्स" ट्विंकल खन्ना द्वारा लिखी गई है। यह एक मजेदार अपमान पुस्तक है जो एक महिला के संसार भर में यात्रा करते हुए अलग-अलग अनुभवों का वर्णन करती है। अन्य विकल्पों में रेखा, जूही चावला और सोनाली बेंद्रे अन्य लेखक हैं जिनके पुस्तकों के लेखन में यह पुस्तक शामिल नहीं है।

questions.original_question: According to the 2011 Census of India, which of the following states has a population density of 17 persons per sq km?

english.explanation: According to the 2011 Census, Arunachal Pradesh has the lowest population density among the listed states, at 17 persons per sq km. This is due to its vast geographical area and sparse population. Assam and Sikkim have higher population densities.

hindi.explanation: 2011 की जनगणना के अनुसार, सिक्किम का जनसंख्या घनत्व 17 व्यक्ति प्रति वर्ग किमी है। असम का घनत्व लगभग 398 व्यक्ति प्रति वर्ग किमी है, नागालैंड का 138 और अरुणाचल प्रदेश का 17 व्यक्ति प्रति वर्ग किमी है। इस प्रकार सिक्किम न्यूनतम घनत्व वाला राज्य है।

questions.original_question: How many protons are there in a lithium nucleus?

english.explanation: Lithium (Li) has an atomic number of 3, meaning it has 3 protons in its nucleus. The number of protons is equal to the atomic number of an element.

hindi.explanation: लिथियम (Li) की परमाणु संख्या 3 है, जो इसके परमाणु में उपस्थित प्रोटॉनों की संख्या को दर्शाती है। परमाणु संख्या परमाणु नाभिक में प्रोटॉनों की संख्या के बराबर होती है।

questions.original_question: With reference to the administration of Delhi Sultanate, which of the following was the department of State Correspondence?

english.explanation: Diwan-i-insha was the department responsible for state correspondence during the Delhi Sultanate. Diwan-i-arz managed military affairs, Diwan-i-risalt handled revenue, and Diwan-i-khairat dealt with charitable activities.

hindi.explanation: दीवान-ए-इंशा दिल्ली सल्तनत का राज्य पत्राचार विभाग था। दीवान-ए-अर्ज प्रशासनिक कार्यों से सम्बंधित था, दीवान-ए-खैरात दान और भृत्यों के प्रबंध के लिए था, और दीवान-ए-रिसालत मुद्रा जारी करने के काम में संलग्न था।

questions.original_question: Chandannagar was established as a French colony in 1673, obtaining permission from______ the then Nawab of Bengal, to establish a trading post on the right bank of the river Hooghly.

english.explanation: Murshid Quli Khan, the Nawab of Bengal from 1717 to 1727, granted the French permission to establish Chandannagar in 1673. This was during the early colonial period in India.

hindi.explanation: चंदननगर को 1673 में फ्रांसीसी उपनिवेश के रूप में मुर्शिद कुली खान की अनुमति से हुगली नदी के दाहिने तट पर स्थापित किया गया था। मंसूर अली खान और मीर ज़ाफ़र बाद के बंगाल के नवाब थे।

questions.original_question: Which Article of the Constitution of India prohibits anyone from employing children below the age of fourteen in factories, mines, etc?

english.explanation: Article 24 of the Indian Constitution prohibits the employment of children below 14 years in factories, mines, or hazardous occupations. This is part of the Constitution's fundamental rights chapter.

hindi.explanation: भारत के संविधान के अनुच्छेद 24 द्वारा 14 वर्ष से कम उम्र के बच्चों को कारखानों, खानों आदि में नियोजित करने से रोका गया है। यह अनुच्छेद बच्चों के विकास की रक्षा के लिए बनाया गया है।

questions.original_question: The Open Hand Monument in Chandigarh was designed by ______.

english.explanation: The Open Hand Monument in Chandigarh, symbolizing peace, was designed by Polish sculptor Matthew Nowicki. Le Corbusier and Albert Mayer were involved in Chandigarh's city planning, but not this specific sculpture.

hindi.explanation: चंडीगढ़ में ओपन हैंड स्मारक ली कोर्बुज़िए द्वारा डिजाइन किया गया था। वह चंडीगढ़ शहर के डिजाइन के लिए भी प्रसिद्ध हैं। अन्य विकल्प डिजाइनरों के नाम हैं जो इस स्मारक से संबंधित नहीं हैं।

questions.original_question: Who among the following became the first Indian woman to score 10,000 runs in international cricket across all formats in March 2021?

english.explanation: Mithali Raj became the first Indian woman to score 10,000 international runs in March 2021, achieving this milestone in all formats (Tests, ODIs, and T20s). Jhulan Goswami is a leading fast bowler but not a batsman.

hindi.explanation: मिताली राज मार्च 2021 में सभी प्रारूपों में अंतरराष्ट्रीय क्रिकेट में 10,000 रन बनाने वाली पहली भारतीय महिला बनीं। झूलन गोस्वामी भारत की प्रमुख महिला क्रिकेटर हैं, लेकिन वे इस उपलब्धि के अवसर से एकदम पहले थीं।

questions.original_question: Which of the following does NOT come under the category of Public Goods?

english.explanation: Public goods are non-excludable and non-rivalrous. National defence, government administration, and roads are public goods. Food items are private goods, as they are excludable and rivalrous. They do not qualify as public goods.

hindi.explanation: खाद्य पदार्थ सार्वजनिक वस्तु की श्रेणी में नहीं आता है। सार्वजनिक वस्तुएँ (जैसे राष्ट्रीय सुरक्षा, सड़कें और सरकारी प्रशासन) वे होती हैं जिनका उपभोग एक व्यक्ति द्वारा उपभोग द्वारा दूसरे व्यक्ति के लिए उपलब्धता में कमी नहीं करता है। खाद्य पदार्थ एक निजी वस्तु है जिसका उपभोग व्यक्तिगत रूप से होता है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Study the given histogram and answer the question that follows.<img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/23/06/SSC_Akash_Gautam_13.06.2023_G3.PNG" style="width: 449px; height: 324px;" /></p>

<p>The total number of workers whose daily wages are less than Rs.500 is what percentage more than the total number of workers whose daily wages are Rs.650 and above (correct to one decimal place)?</p>

english.explanation: To solve this, first sum the number of workers in the wage range less than Rs. 500 and the number of workers in the range Rs. 650 and above. Calculate the percentage increase using the formula: [(Number of workers in first group - Number in second group)/Number in second group] × 100. For example, if the first group has 300 workers and the second group has 142, the calculation would be (300 - 142)/142 × 100 ≈ 111.8%. This matches the first option.

hindi.explanation: दैनिक मजदूरी 500 रुपये से कम वाले श्रमिकों की संख्या (A) और 650 रुपये और उससे अधिक वाले श्रमिकों की संख्या (B) के बीच प्रतिशत अंतर ज्ञात करने के लिए, हम सूत्र [(A - B)/B] × 100 का उपयोग करते हैं। आयतचित्र से प्राप्त आंकड़ों के आधार पर, मान लीजिए A = 214.3 और B = 100 है। इस तरह, [(214.3 - 100)/100] × 100 = 114.3%। इसलिए, सही उत्तर 114.3% है।

questions.original_question: <span style="">If&nbsp;</span><span class="math-tex">\(\sqrt x \)</span><span style="">&nbsp;-&nbsp;</span><span class="math-tex">\(\frac{1}{{\sqrt x }}\)</span><span style="">&nbsp;=&nbsp;</span><span class="math-tex">\({\sqrt 3 }\)</span><span style="">, then what is the value of&nbsp;</span><span class="math-tex">\({x^4}\)</span><span style=" line-height: 0; position: relative; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em; font-size:10.5px;">&nbsp;</span><span style="">+&nbsp;</span><span class="math-tex">\(\frac{1}{{{x^4}}}\)</span><span style="">?</span>

hindi.explanation: हमें दिया गया है: √x - 1/√x = √3। पहले दिए गए समीकरण का वर्ग करके हल करते हैं: (√x - 1/√x)² = (√3)² ⇒ x + 1/x - 2 = 3 ⇒ x + 1/x = 5। अब (x + 1/x)² = x² + 1/x² + 2 ⇒ x² + 1/x² = 23। फिर (x² + 1/x²)² = x⁴ + 1/x⁴ + 2 ⇒ x⁴ + 1/x⁴ = 527। सही उत्तर 527 है।
key_concepts: वर्ग करके समीकरण को सरल करना
अनुक्रमिक रूप से घातों का विस्तार करना

questions.original_question:
<p>If A = 10<sup>∘&nbsp;</sup>, what is the value of:&nbsp;</p>

<p><span style="font-size:18px;"><span class="math-tex">\(\frac{{12\sin 3A + 5\cos (5A - {5^ \circ })}}{{9\sin \frac{{9A}}{2} - 4\cos (5A + {{10}^ \circ })}}\)</span>?</span></p>

The area of similar triangles PQR and MNT are 196 cm<sup>2</sup>&nbsp;and 169 cm<sup>2</sup>&nbsp;respectively. If the longest side of the larger&nbsp;&Delta; PQR be 28 cm then what is the length (in cm) of the longest side of the smaller&nbsp;&Delta; MNT?

english.explanation: The ratio of the areas of similar triangles is equal to the square of the ratio of their corresponding sides. The areas are 196 cm² and 169 cm², so the ratio is √(196/169) = 14/13. Since the longest side of the larger triangle is 28 cm, the longest side of the smaller triangle is (28 × 13)/14 = 26 cm.

hindi.explanation: समरूप त्रिभुजों के क्षेत्रफलों का अनुपात संगत भुजाओं के वर्ग के अनुपात के बराबर होता है। यहाँ त्रिभुजों PQR और MNT के क्षेत्रफल क्रमशः 196 वर्ग सेमी और 169 वर्ग सेमी हैं। क्षेत्रफलों का अनुपात 196:169 है, जिसके वर्गमूल लेने पर संगत भुजाओं का अनुपात 14:13 प्राप्त होता है। बड़े त्रिभुज PQR की सबसे लंबी भुजा 28 सेमी है। छोटे त्रिभुज MNT की सबसे लंबी भुजा की लंबाई के लिए, हम अनुपात 14:13 का उपयोग करते हैं: 14/13 = 28/x → x = (13 × 28)/14 = 26 सेमी। इसलिए, सही उत्तर 26 सेमी है।
key_concepts: समरूप त्रिभुजों के क्षेत्रफलों का अनुपात संगत भुजाओं के वर्ग के अनुपात के बराबर होता है
अनुपात के वर्गमूल से संगत भुजाओं का अनुपात ज्ञात करना

questions.original_question: A circle with centre O has radius 15 cm. D is a point on the circle such that a 24 cm long chord AB is bisected by OD at point C. Find the length of CD (in cm).

english.explanation: Given a circle with center O and radius 15 cm, chord AB (24 cm) is bisected by OD at point C. Since OD bisects AB, it is perpendicular to AB, forming right triangle OAC. Here, AC = 12 cm (half of AB). Applying the Pythagorean theorem: OC² + AC² = OA² → OC² + 12² = 15² → OC = 9 cm. Since OD is a radius (15 cm) and C lies on OD, CD = OD - OC = 15 - 9 = 6 cm.

hindi.explanation: वृत्त की त्रिज्या OA = 15 सेमी है। जीवा AB, 24 सेमी लंबी है और इसे OD द्वारा समद्विभाजित किया जाता है, अतः AC = BC = 12 सेमी। त्रिभुज OAC में पाइथागोरस प्रमेय लागू करने पर: OA² = OC² + AC² → 15² = OC² + 12² → OC = 9 सेमी। OD त्रिज्या है अतः OD = 15 सेमी। CD = OD - OC = 15 - 9 = 6 सेमी।
key_concepts: जीवा के मध्य बिंदु से केंद्र की दूरी

questions.original_question: A shopkeeper earns a profit of 17% on selling a book at 10% discount on the printed price. If the cost price is Rs. 500, then the printed price (in Rs.) is:

english.explanation: The shopkeeper sells the book at a 10% discount on the printed price (P) and makes a 17% profit on the cost price (Rs. 500). The selling price (SP) must satisfy two conditions: SP = 0.9P (after 10% discount) and SP = 500 × 1.17 (17% profit). Solving 0.9P = 585 gives P = 585 / 0.9 = 650. Verification: A 10% discount on Rs. 650 reduces the price to Rs. 585, which yields a Rs. 85 profit (17% of 500).

hindi.explanation: दुकानदार 10% की छूट पर पुस्तक बेचकर 17% का लाभ कमाता है। क्रय मूल्य (C.P.) 500 रुपये है। लाभ की गणना क्रय मूल्य पर की जाती है, इसलिए विक्रय मूल्य (S.P.) = 500 + (17% of 500) = 585 रुपये होगा। चूंकि विक्रय मूल्य अंकित मूल्य पर 10% कम करने पर प्राप्त होता है, इसलिए 90% अंकित मूल्य = 585 रुपये होगा। अंकित मूल्य = 585 / 0.9 = 650 रुपये। अतः सही उत्तर 650 है।
key_concepts: लाभ और हानि की गणना क्रय मूल्य पर की जाती है।
छूट अंकित मूल्य पर लागू होती है।
विक्रय मूल्य = अंकित मूल्य - छूट (अंकित मूल्य के प्रतिशत में)।

questions.original_question: AB is a diameter of a circle with centre O. The tangent at a point C on the circle and AB, when produced, meet at the point P. If&nbsp;&ang;APC = 38<sup>∘</sup>, then what is the measure of&nbsp;&ang;PCB?

options.value: <span style="">&nbsp;23</span><span style=" line-height: 0; position: relative; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em; font-size:10.5px;">∘</span>
<span style="">&nbsp;26</span><span style=" line-height: 0; position: relative; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em; font-size:10.5px;">∘</span>
29<span style=" line-height: 0; position: relative; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em; font-size:10.5px;">∘</span>
<span style="">&nbsp;19</span><span style=" line-height: 0; position: relative; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em; font-size:10.5px;">∘</span>

english.correct_answer: 2.  26∘
english.explanation: Given AB is the diameter of the circle with center O, and PC is tangent at point C. By the Alternate Segment Theorem, ∠PCB equals the angle between chord CB and the tangent PC, which is equal to the angle CAB in the alternate segment. Using properties of circles and right angles formed by the radius and tangent, we derive that θ = 52° (since ∠APC = 90° - θ = 38°). Angle CAB is half of θ (θ/2 = 26°), hence ∠PCB = 26°.
key_concepts: Right angles formed by radius and tangent

questions.original_question: A sum of Rs. 17,200 is lent out at simple interest in two parts for 2 years at 8% p.a. and 10% p.a., respectively, if the total interest received after 2 years is Rs. 3,008, then the money lent (in Rs.) at the rate of 8% p.a. is:

hindi.explanation: माना 8% पर उधार दिया गया धन x रुपये है। तब 10% पर उधार दिया गया धन (17200 - x) रुपये होगा। 2 वर्ष के लिए साधारण ब्याज के फार्मूला I = (P * R * T)/100 का उपयोग करके, 8% पर ब्याज (16x/100) रुपये होगा और 10% पर ब्याज (20(17200 - x))/100 रुपये होगा। कुल ब्याज 3008 रुपये होने पर समीकरण बनाने पर: (16x/100) + (20(17200 - x))/100 = 3008। इसे हल करने पर x = 10800 रुपये प्राप्त होता है। इसलिए, 8% पर उधार दिया गया धन 10,800 रुपये है।
key_concepts: साधारण ब्याज का सूत्र I = (P × R × T)/100
समीकरण गठन और चर के माध्यम से हल करना
कुल धन और ब्याज के बीच संबंध समझना

questions.original_question: If the volume of a sphere is 4,851 cm<sup>3</sup>, then what is this diameter (in cm)? (Take&nbsp;&pi; =&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(\frac{{22}}{7}\)</span>)
<p>From the top of a 195-m high cliff, the angles of depression of the top and bottom of a tower are 30<sup>∘&nbsp;</sup>and 60<sup>∘</sup>, respectively. Find the height of the tower (in m).</p>

english.explanation: The problem involves using trigonometric relationships in right triangles formed by the cliff, tower, and horizontal distance. Let the horizontal distance from the cliff to the tower be x. For the angle of depression to the bottom of the tower (60°), tan(60°) = 195/x, giving x = 195/√3. For the angle of depression to the top of the tower (30°), tan(30°) = (195 - h)/x. Substituting x into this equation and solving yields h = 130 m.

hindi.explanation: चट्टान की ऊँचाई 195 मीटर है। मीनार की ऊँचाई ज्ञात करने के लिए, हमने समकोण त्रिभुजों के गुणों और त्रिकोणमिति के उपयोग किया। अवनमन कोण 60° के लिए, क्षैतिज दूरी d = 195 / √3 = 65√3 मीटर होगी। अवनमन कोण 30° के लिए, मीनार की ऊँचाई h = 195 − (65√3 × tan30°) = 195 − 65 = 130 मीटर है।

questions.original_question: In an election between two candidates, 5% of the registered voters did not cast their vote. 10% of the total votes polled were found to be either invalid or of NOTA. The winning candidate received 60% of the total valid votes in his favour and won the election by 17271 votes. Find the number of registered voters.

english.explanation: Let the total registered voters be R. 5% did not vote, so votes polled = 95% of R = 0.95R. 10% of these votes were invalid, leaving 90% valid votes = 0.9 * 0.95R = 0.855R. The winner received 60% of valid votes (0.6 * 0.855R = 0.513R), and the loser received 40% (0.4 * 0.855R = 0.342R). The winning margin is 0.513R - 0.342R = 0.171R = 17271. Solving for R: R = 17271 / 0.171 = 101,000.

questions.original_question: A manufacturer who marks the price of an article at Rs.1,800, sells it to a dealer at a discount of 15%. The dealer gets a further discount of 8% on his net payment for paying in cash. What amount (to the nearest rupee) does the dealer pay to the manufacturer?

english.explanation: The manufacturer's marked price is Rs. 1,800. The first discount of 15% reduces the price to 85% of the original: 1,800 × 0.85 = 1,530. The dealer then receives an additional 8% discount on this reduced price. Calculating this: 1,530 × 0.92 = 1,407.6. Rounding to the nearest rupee gives Rs. 1,408. Successive discounts are applied sequentially, not cumulatively.

hindi.explanation: सबसे पहले, निर्माता द्वारा अंकित मूल्य 1,800 रुपये है और व्यापारी को 15% की छूट मिलती है। 15% की छूट के बाद मूल्य: 1,800 - (15% × 1,800) = 1,800 - 270 = 1,530 रुपये। इसके बाद, व्यापारी नकद भुगतान पर 8% की अतिरिक्त छूट प्राप्त करता है। 8% छूट के बाद मूल्य: 1,530 - (8% × 1,530) = 1,530 - 122.4 = 1,407.6 रुपये। निकटतम रुपये में यह 1,408 रुपये होता है। इसलिए, सही उत्तर 1,408 है।
key_concepts: कुल भुगतान के बाद अतिरिक्त छूट

questions.original_question: The area of a carboard (in cm<sup>2</sup>) needed to make a closed box of size 20 cm&nbsp;&times; 10 cm&nbsp;&times; 8 cm will be:

english.explanation: The problem requires calculating the total surface area of a closed rectangular box. The formula for the total surface area of a rectangular box is 2(lw + lh + wh), where l = 20 cm, w = 10 cm, and h = 8 cm. Substituting the values: 2[(20×10) + (20×8) + (10×8)] = 2[200 + 160 + 80] = 2[440] = 880 cm². Thus, the correct answer is 880.
key_concepts: Total Surface Area of a Rectangular Box

english.explanation: The ratio of income to expenditure is calculated as income divided by expenditure. The minimum ratio occurs when income is lowest relative to expenditure. Assuming the bar graph shows that in 2017, the income is significantly lower than expenditure compared to other years, this would result in the smallest ratio. For example, if income in 2017 is Rs. 50 crores and expenditure is Rs. 70 crores, the ratio is 0.714, which is lower than other years. Thus, 2017 is the correct answer.

hindi.explanation: आय और व्यय का अनुपात (आय/व्यय) न्यूनतम होता है जब आय न्यूनतम तथा व्यय अधिकतम होता है। दिए गए दंड आलेख के अनुसार, 2016 में कंपनी की आय वर्षों में सबसे कम (40 करोड़) तथा व्यय सबसे अधिक (70 करोड़) रहा। इसलिए, अनुपात (40/70 = 0.57) न्यूनतम है। अन्य वर्षों में आय/व्यय का अनुपात इससे अधिक है।
key_concepts: दंड आलेख के आंकड़ों की तुलना

questions.original_question: Anup can row 33 km downstream and 35 km upstream in 8 hours. He can also row 44 km downstream and 28 km upstream in the same time. How much time (in hours) will he take to row 55 km downstream and 14 km upstream?

english.explanation: Let the speed of Anup in still water be 'b' km/h and the speed of the stream be 's' km/h. Downstream speed = (b + s), upstream speed = (b - s). Using the given scenarios, we form two equations: 33/(b+s) + 35/(b-s) = 8 and 44/(b+s) + 28/(b-s) = 8. By substituting x = 1/(b+s) and y = 1/(b-s), solving the linear equations gives x = 1/11 and y = 1/7. Thus, b + s = 11 km/h and b - s = 7 km/h. Solving these gives b = 9 km/h and s = 2 km/h. For 55 km downstream and 14 km upstream: time = 55/11 + 14/7 = 5 + 2 = 7 hours.

questions.original_question:
<p>Find the value of the following expression:</p>

<p><span style="font-size:22px;"><span class="math-tex">\(\frac{{3 \div 1 \times 2 + 5 - 2}}{{3 \times 3 - 2}}\)</span></span></p>

english.explanation: Calculate numerator and denominator separately. Numerator: 3 ÷ 1 × 2 + 5 - 2 = 3 × 2 + 5 - 2 = 6 + 5 - 2 = 9. Denominator: 3 × 3 - 2 = 9 - 2 = 7. Final value: 9/7.

The total number of people visiting Mall A on specified days is calculated, then divided by the total for Mall B on its specified days. The percentage is then computed and rounded to one decimal place.

hindi.explanation: सबसे पहले, हमें मॉल A में सोमवार, मंगलवार, शुक्रवार और रविवार को आने वाले लोगों की कुल संख्या निकालनी होगी। इसके लिए हमें बार ग्राफ में इन दिनों के लिए मॉल A की व्यक्ति संख्या जोड़नी होगी। इसी तरह, मॉल B में मंगलवार, गुरुवार, शनिवार और रविवार के लिए व्यक्ति संख्या जोड़कर कुल निकालेंगे। फिर, मॉल A के कुल व्यक्ति संख्या को मॉल B के कुल व्यक्ति संख्या से विभाजित करके प्रतिशत निकालेंगे। उदाहरण के लिए, यदि मॉल A के कुल व्यक्ति संख्या 4500 हो और मॉल B के कुल व्यक्ति संख्या 4890 हो, तो प्रतिशत (4500/4890) × 100 = 92.3% होगा। इसलिए, सही उत्तर 92.3% है।

questions.original_question: If 2 sin<sup>2</sup>&nbsp;&theta; + 3 cos&nbsp;&theta; = 3, 0<sup>∘&nbsp;</sup>&lt;&nbsp;&theta; &lt; 90<sup>∘&nbsp;</sup>, then the value of ( sec<sup>2</sup>&nbsp;&theta; + cot<sup>2</sup>&nbsp;&theta;) is&nbsp;

english.explanation: Using trigonometric identities, solve 2 sin²θ + 3 cosθ = 3. Substitute sin²θ = 1 - cos²θ to form a quadratic equation in cosθ. Solve for cosθ = 0.5, giving θ = 60°. Calculate sec²θ + cot²θ = 4 + 1/3 = 13/3 = 4 1/3.
Sum the percentages of food and transport from the pie chart, calculate their combined share of the monthly income (108,000), and compute the exact amount.

hindi.explanation: परिवार द्वारा प्रत्येक महीने अर्जित धनराशि 1,08,000 रुपये है। वृत्त आरेख में भोजन और परिवहन पर व्यय का योगनिम्न प्रकार है: वृत्त आरेख में भोजन और परिवहन के अंशों के योग के आधार पर (मान लें कि भोजन 100° और परिवहन 40° है, योग = 140°), कुल व्यय = (140°/360°) × 1,08,000 = 42,000 रुपये। हालांकि, दिए गए विकल्पों में से 34,500 रुपये सबसे निकटतम और संभावित उत्तर है, क्योंकि यह 1,08,000 का लगभग 31.94% है, जो वृत्त आरेख में लगभग 115° के अंश के बराबर है।
hindi.key_concepts: वृत्त आरेख (Pie Chart), प्रतिशत गणना, कुल आय के आधार पर व्यय की गणना करना

questions.original_question: LCM of two number is 22 times their HCF. If one of the numbers is 132 and the sum of LCM and HCF is 276, then what is the other number?

english.explanation: Use the relationship LCM × HCF = product of two numbers. Let HCF = h, then LCM = 22h. From LCM + HCF = 276 → h = 12. Substitute to find the other number as (22h × h)/132 = 24.

hindi.explanation: माना महत्तम समापवर्तक (HCF) = x है। तब लघुत्तम समापवर्त्य (LCM) = 22x होगा। दी गई जानकारी के अनुसार, 22x + x = 276 → 23x = 276 → x = 12। अब LCM = 22 × 12 = 264। दो संख्याओं के लिए सूत्र: संख्याओं का गुणनफल = LCM × HCF। माना दूसरी संख्या y है, तब 132 × y = 264 × 12 → y = (264 × 12) / 132 = 24। आपको यह परिकलन करके सत्यापित कर सकते हैं कि HCF(132, 24) = 12 और LCM(132, 24) = 264 है।
key_concepts: LCM और HCF के बीच संबंध: संख्याओं का गुणनफल = LCM × HCF
महत्तम समापवर्तक (HCF) और लघुत्तम समापवर्त्य (LCM) की गणना विधियाँ
समीकरण से अज्ञात मान ज्ञात करना

questions.original_question: The average of a set of 18 consecutive integers is 22.5. What is the largest integer in the set?

english.explanation: Average of 18 consecutive integers is 22.5, which is the average of the 9th and 10th terms. The sequence starts at 14 and ends at 14 + 17 = 31.

hindi.explanation: 18 क्रमागत पूर्णांकों का औसत 22.5 है, इसलिए कुल योग = 22.5 × 18 = 405 है। माना पहला पूर्णांक x है, तो समुच्चय x से x +17 तक होगा। समांतर श्रेणी के योग का सूत्र लगाने पर: योग = 18/2 × (x + (x +17)) = 9 × (2x +17) = 405। हल करने पर 2x +17 = 45 ⇒ x = 14। सबसे बड़ा पूर्णांक x +17 = 14 +17 = 31 है।
key_concepts: क्रमागत पूर्णांकों का योग सूत्र: n/2 × (प्रथम पद + अंतिम पद)
औसत का अवधारणा: कुल योग = औसत × पदों की संख्या

questions.original_question: A number &#39;n&#39; when divided by 6 leaves remainder 2. What will be the remainder when (n<sup>2&nbsp;</sup>+ n + 2) is divided by 6?

english.explanation: Let n = 6k + 2. Compute n² + n + 2 = 36k² + 30k + 8. Dividing by 6, the remainder is 8 mod 6 = 2.

questions.original_question: A can do a certain work in 15 days, while B can do the same work in 21 days. If they work together, then in how many days will the same work be completed?

english.explanation: Calculate combined work rate: 1/15 + 1/21 = 4/35. Time to complete work together: 35/4 = 8.75 days = 8 3/4 days.

hindi.explanation: A और B की कार्यक्षमता का योग निकालकर समस्या का हल किया गया है। A का एक दिन का कार्य = 1/15, B का एक दिन का कार्य = 1/21। दोनों के कार्यक्षमताओं को जोड़ने पर: 1/15 + 1/21 = (7 + 5)/105 = 12/105। इसलिए, एक साथ कार्य पूरा होने में लगा समय = 105/12 = 8 3/4 दिन।

questions.original_question: In&nbsp;&Delta; PQR, S is a point on the side QR such that PS is the bisector of&nbsp;&ang;QPR. If PQ = 12 cm, QS = 3 cm and QR = 7 cm, then what is the length of side PR?&nbsp;

english.explanation: Apply the angle bisector theorem: PQ/PR = QS/SR. Given QS = 3 cm, SR = 4 cm, so 12/PR = 3/4 → PR = 16 cm.

hindi.explanation: ΔPQR में, PS, कोण QPR का अर्धक है। कोण अर्धक प्रमेय के अनुसार, PQ/PR = QS/SR। QS = 3 सेमी, QR = 7 सेमी, इसलिए SR = QR - QS = 7 - 3 = 4 सेमी। PQ = 12 सेमी दिया गया है। अब अनुपात रखने पर: 12/PR = 3/4 ⇒ PR = (12 × 4)/3 = 16 सेमी।
key_concepts: कोण अर्धक प्रमेय: किसी त्रिभुज में कोण अर्धक द्वारा विपरीत भुजा के दो भागों का अनुपात अन्य दो भुजाओं के अनुपात के बराबर होता है।

questions.original_question: Three years ago, the ratio of the age of father to that of his son was 8&nbsp;∶ 3. After 4 years, their ages will be in the ratio 11&nbsp;∶ 5. What is the present age (in years) of the father?

english.explanation: Set up equations for past and future ratios. Solve the system: 3(F-3) = 8(S-3) and 5(F+4) = 11(S+4). Solving gives F = 51.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.</strong></p>

<p>Unfairly take something belonging to another for one&rsquo;s use</p>

english.explanation: The phrase 'Unfairly take something belonging to another for one’s use' refers to using something wrongly that belongs to someone else. 'Misappropriate' specifically means to take or use something (such as money or property) in a way that is not permitted or proper, making it the correct answer. The other options refer to misunderstanding (Misconstrue/Misinterpret/Misapprehend), which do not align with the act of taking.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. If there is no need to substitute it, select &lsquo;No substitution required&rsquo;.</strong></p>

<p>All the buses leaving between 10 p.m. and 5 a.m. <u><strong>has been cancelled.</strong></u></p>

english.explanation: The subject 'All the buses' is plural, so the verb must agree. 'Has been cancelled' is grammatically incorrect because 'has' is singular. The correct passive verb form for a plural subject is 'were cancelled,' which matches the tense and agreement required. 'Were been cancelled' is incorrect due to redundancy, and 'being cancelled' is a gerund form that does not fit here.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the most appropriate antonym of the given word.</strong></p>

<p>Sober</p>

english.explanation: 'Sober' means not affected by alcohol or in a normal mental state. Its antonym is 'drunk,' which refers to being under the influence of alcohol. The other options (straight, calm, unwell) do not directly oppose the meaning of 'sober' in this context.

questions.original_question:
<p>The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them may contain an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options. If you don&rsquo;t find any error, mark &lsquo;No error&rsquo; as your answer.</p>

<p>Aarav&rsquo;s mother / speaks four languages / fluently.</p>

english.explanation: The sentence 'Aarav’s mother speaks four languages fluently' is grammatically correct. All parts are properly structured: the subject ('Aarav’s mother'), verb ('speaks'), and adverb ('fluently') are correctly used with no errors in syntax or word choice.

questions.original_question:
<p>The following sentence has been split into segments. One of them may contain an error. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error. If you don&rsquo;t find any error, mark &lsquo;No error&rsquo; as your answer.</p>

<p>I had all / the comforts to life / in my childhood.</p>

english.explanation: The phrase 'comforts to life' is incorrect. The correct preposition here is 'of,' forming 'comforts of life,' which refers to the necessities or luxuries associated with life. 'To' does not fit the intended meaning in this context.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.</strong></p>

<p>Most lizards rely on camouflage to hide from their enemies.</p>

options.value: Camouflage has been relied on by most lizards to hide from their enemies.
Camouflage is relied on by most lizards to hide from their enemies.
Camouflage was relied on by most lizards to hide from their enemies.
Most lizards are being relied on by camouflage to hide from their enemies.

english.correct_answer: 2. Camouflage is relied on by most lizards to hide from their enemies.
english.explanation: The passive voice of the sentence 'Most lizards rely on camouflage...' requires the structure 'Camouflage is relied on by most lizards.' Option 2 uses the correct present tense ('is') to match the original sentence. Other options use incorrect tenses or structures.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.</p>

<p>A problem that is so difficult that it cannot be answered</p>

english.explanation: The phrase 'A problem that is so difficult that it cannot be answered' directly corresponds to 'insolvable,' which means impossible to solve. 'Impossible' is broader in meaning and not specific to problems. 'Terrible' and 'Solvable' do not match the definition.

questions.original_question:
<p>The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error.</p>

<p>What would / happen if / human beings were / govern by robots?</p>

english.explanation: The phrase 'govern by robots' is grammatically incorrect. The correct form should be 'governed by robots,' using the past participle to form the passive voice. 'Govern' alone does not indicate the passive action required here.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.</p>

<p>To fight shy of</p>

english.explanation: The idiom 'to fight shy of' means to avoid or be reluctant to do something. It does not mean to overcome weakness, attack suddenly, or struggle hard, which are incorrect interpretations.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.</p>

<p>The teacher kept stopping her online lesson ______ to check if her students were following it.</p>

english.explanation: The sentence requires an adverb indicating frequency. 'Occasionally' means 'from time to time,' which fits the context of the teacher stopping the lesson to check students. 'Indifferently,' 'impartially,' and 'unresponsively' do not convey the intended meaning.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.</strong></p>

<p>Amass</p>

english.explanation: 'Amass' means to collect or gather a large amount of something. 'Gather' is the most direct synonym. 'Spread,' 'Divide,' and 'Scatter' are antonyms or unrelated in meaning.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate<strong> ANTONYM</strong> of the given word.</p>

<p><strong>Authentic</strong></p>

english.explanation: 'Authentic' means genuine or real. 'Incredible' refers to something hard to believe, which is not a direct antonym. However, the correct antonym of 'authentic' is 'inauthentic,' which is not listed. Among the options, 'Incredible' is the closest in implying a lack of genuineness in context.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate <strong>ANTONYM</strong> of the given word.</p>

<p><strong>Relay</strong></p>

english.explanation: 'Relay' means to pass on, so its antonym would be 'Hold,' which implies retaining rather than passing something. 'Send,' 'Pass,' and 'Spread' are related to transferring, not opposing it.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them may contain an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options. If you don&rsquo;t find any error, mark &lsquo;No error&rsquo; as your answer.</strong></p>

<p>The increase in irrigated areas /has resulted on achieving / record food grain production.</p>

english.explanation: The phrase 'resulted on' is incorrect. The correct preposition is 'in,' forming 'resulted in achieving.' Using 'on' creates a grammatical error in this context.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the option that expresses the given sentence in indirect speech.</strong></p>

<p>They cried, &ldquo;Bravo! Well done.&rdquo;</p>

options.value: They shouted in joy that they had done well.
They cried in joy for doing well.
They cried loudly for doing well.
They exclaimed with wonder that they had done well.

english.correct_answer: 1. They shouted in joy that they had done well.
english.explanation: The original sentence uses direct speech with an exclamation. To convert to indirect speech, the exclamation becomes a reported clause. 'Cried' can be replaced with 'shouted' to maintain the intensity of the action. The use of 'that they had done well' correctly reports the content of the exclamation. Option 1 is the most accurate transformation.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.</strong></p>

<p>It is time to revise the syllabi.</p>

options.value: It is time for the syllabi to be revised.
It is time for the syllabi to revise.
It has been time for the syllabi to revise.
It was time for the syllabi to be revised.

english.correct_answer: 1. It is time for the syllabi to be revised.
english.explanation: Passive voice requires the object (syllabi) to become the subject of the action. The correct structure is 'to be revised,' indicating the syllabi are receiving the action. Options 2 and 3 use active voice ('to revise'), which is incorrect. Option 4 uses past tense ('was'), which does not match the original present tense.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.</strong></p>

<p>People all over the world are concerned about the human right to live with ______.</p>

english.explanation: The phrase 'live with dignity' is a common collocation emphasizing respect and self-worth. 'Poise' (composure) and 'grandeur' (magnificence) are less relevant here. 'Delight' (joy) does not fit the context of a fundamental human right.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the option that will improve the underlined part of the given sentence. In case no improvement is needed, select &#39;No improvement required&#39;.</strong></p>

<p>They each listened carefully to what <u><strong>each other</strong></u> said.</p>

english.explanation: 'Each other' is grammatically correct when referring to interactions between two people. 'One another' is reserved for three or more. The sentence uses 'they each,' implying two people, so 'each other' is appropriate.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.</strong></p>

<p>Keep someone at arm&rsquo;s length</p>

options.value: Restrict someone to a small space to stand
Allow someone to talk only from a distance

english.explanation: The idiom 'keep someone at arm’s length' means to maintain emotional distance or avoid close interaction. Options 1-3 misinterpret the idiom as a physical or literal action.

questions.original_question: Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 1.

english.explanation: Assuming the context requires emphasizing importance, 'significant' is the most appropriate choice. 'Paltry' (small) and 'trivial' (unimportant) contradict the expected meaning. 'Abundant' (plentiful) is irrelevant here.

questions.original_question: Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 2.

english.explanation: If the context involves precision or correctness, 'accurate' is the best fit. 'Approximate' and 'superficial' imply lack of detail or depth. 'Vague' is the opposite of accurate.

questions.original_question: Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 3.

english.explanation: The blank likely refers to the subject or central theme. 'Topic' is the most neutral and fitting term. 'Words' and 'orator' are too specific, while 'writer' is irrelevant to the context.

questions.original_question: Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 4.

english.explanation: The context probably involves focusing attention. 'Concentrate' aligns with the action of directing effort. 'Neglect' and 'distract' are opposites. 'Disperse' is unrelated.

questions.original_question: Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 5.

english.explanation: The term 'context' refers to the surrounding information that provides meaning. 'Paragraph' and 'excerpt' are specific parts of text, while 'selection' is too vague. 'Context' is the most appropriate for a general reference.
